function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Insufficient planning and design of infrastructure for halting the spread of pandemics","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread, higher infection rates, and potential for widespread outbreaks","Mitigation":"Incorporate ventilation, physical distancing, and movement-friendly spaces into infrastructure design","Technologies":"Air filtration systems, smart sensors for crowd monitoring, and spatial design tools","People":"General public, commuters, and residents of built environments","Owner":"Urban planners, architects, and public health officials"},{"Description":"Neglect of economic potential of infrastructure in preparing or responding to pandemics","Impact":"Missed opportunities for using infrastructure to mitigate the economic impact of pandemics","Mitigation":"Conduct careful investigation of the economic importance of infrastructure in pandemic preparedness and response","Technologies":"Economic modeling software, cost-benefit analysis tools, and infrastructure resilience assessments","People":"Economists, policymakers, and infrastructure financiers","Owner":"Government agencies, financial institutions, and research institutions"},{"Description":"Overlooked relationship between infrastructure, agglomeration, and pandemics","Impact":"Lack of understanding of how infrastructure and agglomeration patterns contribute to disease spread and containment","Mitigation":"Conduct careful investigation of the links between infrastructure, agglomeration, and pandemics to inform future planning and policy-making","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, urban planning simulations, and network modeling software","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, and policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, and urban planning organizations"}]}
